intro: Sticherus laevigatus, commonly known as the smooth sticherus, is a small, perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that are typically smooth and hairless. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shady environments, often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Sticherus laevigatus is primarily valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and maintaining soil stability in its native habitats.
